title: Data Analyst Internship - Korea Finance
summary: The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.Now hiring a bright and motivated individual for a key role in financial support of the Carrier business within Apple Korea. The role would play a key part of a dynamic and agile Sales Finance organization.
description: As a Finance intern, you will support the Korea Sales Finance team and play a role in driving Apple Korea’s business growth by analyzing financial performance and providing insights. During the internship period, you will work on the following areas: Data analysis and reporting: Collaborate with Finance/Sales teams to identify key performance metrics and reporting requirements. Utilize Excel, SQL, and Tableau to analyze financial and sales data and develop interactive business intelligence dashboards to visualize. Business Process Improvements: Develop and maintain automated reporting processes to streamline data collection and analysis. Communicate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders to continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented improvements. Key Interaction with: Korea Sales Finance team and Korea Sales BPR (Business Process Reengineering) team Sales Managers and their respective sales teams North Asia Sales Finance team in Tokyo and Worldwide Sales Finance in Cupertino
key_qualifications: Currently enrolled in a graduate program with a focus on Finance, Business Analytics, or a related field who is willing to participate in the Internship Program for 6 months. Strong proficiency in Excel, SQL with familiarity with Tableau or other business intelligence tools for dashboard development and data visualization. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and generate actionable insights. Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and data integrity. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment. Fluency in English and Korean. Eligible to work in Korea
